definition: to stand still without advancing (idiom); to hesitate and hold back
to bind/to wrap/a bundle/a parcel
excessive
foot/to be sufficient/ample
(negative prefix)/not/no
front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly

sentences.english: Negligence of English grammar teaching becomes a bottle-neck of English-learning.
sentences.chinese: 基礎語法知識的薄弱導致了英語學習的裹足不前。

sentences.english: From a just responsibility I will never shrink.
sentences.chinese: 對應盡的責任我決不會裹足不前。

sentences.english: Many organizations are still dragging their feet on it.
All your money won't stop me.
sentences.chinese: 你的臭錢，那是不能讓我裹足不前的。

sentences.english: The filth here deters all but the invited guest.
sentences.chinese: 這裏污穢不堪，除非有事，外人是裹足不前的。

definition: hesitant to take action
to hesitate to move forward/to hesitate/to hold back
to shrink back in fear (idiom); too cowardly to advance
stuck and not moving forward (idiom); stagnant/in a rut/at a standstill
afraid of the head, terrified of the tail (idiom); ever fearful and nervous/afraid of the slightest thing
stuck in the old ways (idiom); refusing to acknowledge new ideas/stagnating and conservative
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); at a loss/in a hopeless situation
to hesitate to move forward/to balk/to jib
to be at a standstill/to mark time
(idiom) to continue in the same old rut/diehard conservative attitudes
to sit and waste a good opportunity (idiom); to lose the chance
to mark time (military)/to make no headway
to look forward and back/to consider prudently/overcautious
attempting nothing and accomplishing nothing (idiom); without any initiative or drive/feckless
hesitant and not daring to move forward (idiom)
timid/gutless/weakling
